description.raw:
Coulomb joint friction was added for BulletHingeJoint in pull request #1317, but it wasn't working for BulletSliderJoint (#1348). I just found an [upstream bug in bullet](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/pull/328) that I've reported and for which I've submitted a fix that should make it into bullet 2.83. In the meantime, I have a workaround here for bullet 2.82.

I enabled the joint friction test for this joint in 25e5874 and will update with jenkins results when they are available.

To test manually, load the `joint_friction_demo.world` with ODE to see the expected behavior. There are 3 rows of pendulums and a row of prismatic joints at the back that have different friction values. Three links with prismatic joints should fall at different rates and one should remain still.
~~~
gazebo --verbose worlds/joint_friction_demo.world -e ode
~~~
Then load with bullet to see that the prismatic joints are working now. Note that two rows of pendulums don't work, since they are using BulletUniversalJoints, which don't yet support joint friction.
~~~
gazebo --verbose worlds/joint_friction_demo.world -e bullet
~~~

I also reduced some of the console spam from the BulletSliderJoint.

Coulomb joint friction was added for BulletHingeJoint in pull request #1317, but it wasn't working for BulletSliderJoint (#1348). I just found an upstream bug in bullet that I've reported and for which I've submitted a fix that should make it into bullet 2.83. In the meantime, I have a workaround here for bullet 2.82.

I enabled the joint friction test for this joint in 25e5874 and will update with jenkins results when they are available.

To test manually, load the joint_friction_demo.world with ODE to see the expected behavior. There are 3 rows of pendulums and a row of prismatic joints at the back that have different friction values. Three links with prismatic joints should fall at different rates and one should remain still.

Then load with bullet to see that the prismatic joints are working now. Note that two rows of pendulums don't work, since they are using BulletUniversalJoints, which don't yet support joint friction.

I also reduced some of the console spam from the BulletSliderJoint.
